hints.content: Start by understanding the provided function `read4`. This function reads up to 4 characters from a source and returns the number of characters read. Familiarize yourself with how to use this function effectively.
Consider how to keep track of the total number of characters read. You will need to accumulate this count until you reach the desired number of characters, `N`.
Think about how to handle cases where the total characters available are less than `N`. What should your function return in this case? Make sure to handle this gracefully.
When calling `read4`, remember that it may not always return exactly 4 characters. You need to check how many characters it actually returns and adjust your logic accordingly.
You will need a buffer to store the characters read from `read4`. Make sure to use this buffer to accumulate characters until you reach the required count of `N`.
Think about how to manage the remaining characters after each read. If `read4` returns fewer than 4 characters, you might have reached the end of the input.
Consider using a loop to repeatedly call `read4` until you either reach `N` characters or exhaust the input. Keep track of how many characters you have read so far.
Make sure to handle edge cases, such as when `N` is 0. In this case, your function should return an empty string immediately without calling `read4`.
As you accumulate characters, remember to copy them into the final output buffer correctly. You may need to ensure that you do not exceed the size of your output buffer.
Finally, ensure that your function returns the correct number of characters read. This is typically done by returning the string formed from the characters you collected.

questionNotes: The function should read up to N characters, not exceeding the total available.
The `read4` function reads at most 4 characters each time it is called.
Handle cases where N is 0 by returning an empty string immediately.
Ensure to return the correct number of characters read, which may be less than N if the end of input is reached.
